description:
Music video animated by Marie Yasui for the song Insomnia by Eve.

Note: The song featured in this music video also serves as the theme song of the 2024 live-action movie "My Home Hero".

title.native: さよならエンドロール

node.description:
__[Website](http://eveofficial.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/oo0Eve0oo) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/eve_harapeco/) | [YouTube](http://www.youtube.com/user/ooo0eve0ooo)__

__Introduction:__
Eve is a Japanese utaite, mangaka, fashion designer, vocalist, guitarist, lyricist and composer under record label TOY'S FACTORY (2019–), having previously been under record label harapeco records (2016–2018). He works closely with the arranger [Tomoki Numano](https://anilist.co/staff/137906/Tomoki-Numano), otherwise known as Numa, who arranges most of his songs.

__Biography:__
He first started uploading covers on NicoNico Douga in April 2009 at the age of 13. Aside from covering songs, he was one of the lead singers for the Japanese indie band einie, alongside Natsushiro Takaaki; he also composed songs and wrote lyrics for the band. 

He started going by the name Eve in October 2009; before that, he had gone by the names Keitora and Kurowa. He also plays the acoustic guitar and sometimes accompanies his songs with his own acoustic arrangements.

__[Website](http://eveofficial.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/oo0Eve0oo) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/eve_harapeco/) | [YouTube](http://www.youtube.com/user/ooo0eve0ooo)__

Marie Yasui, better known as Mariyasu, is a Japanese mangaka, animator, illustrator, character designer, storyboard artist and animation director.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/542675040)

Daisuke Chiba, also known as tyao, is a Japanese composite artist and editor. He established and is affilliated with Folium, a compositing studio.

_Note: Not to be confused with either the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/234488/) or the [director](https://anilist.co/staff/140352/)._

__[Website](https://numanooh1110.wixsite.com/tomoki-numano)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomoki_numano)__

__Tomoki Numano__, alternatively known by stage name Numa, is a Japanese arranger, guitarist and trackmaker known to frequently collaborate with the musician [Eve](https://anilist.co/staff/132869/Eve).

__[Website](http://eveofficial.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/oo0Eve0oo) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/eve_harapeco/) | [YouTube](http://www.youtube.com/user/ooo0eve0ooo)__

__Introduction:__
Eve is a Japanese utaite, mangaka, fashion designer, vocalist, guitarist, lyricist and composer under record label TOY'S FACTORY (2019–), having previously been under record label harapeco records (2016–2018). He works closely with the arranger [Tomoki Numano](https://anilist.co/staff/137906/Tomoki-Numano), otherwise known as Numa, who arranges most of his songs.

__Biography:__
He first started uploading covers on NicoNico Douga in April 2009 at the age of 13. Aside from covering songs, he was one of the lead singers for the Japanese indie band einie, alongside Natsushiro Takaaki; he also composed songs and wrote lyrics for the band. 

He started going by the name Eve in October 2009; before that, he had gone by the names Keitora and Kurowa. He also plays the acoustic guitar and sometimes accompanies his songs with his own acoustic arrangements.
